alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Mercer; Morris; Somerset; Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 7:40AM EDT until September 29 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern New Jersey, including the following counties, in central New Jersey...Mercer. In northern New Jersey...Hunterdon, Morris, Somerset, Sussex, and Warren. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated pockets of heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Trenton, Somerville, Newton, Montague, Bridgewater, Ewing, Dover, Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Wharton, Washington, and Rockaway. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 33. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 37. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 69 and 74. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 17 and 26. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
